definition: pillow/to pillow/to rest one's head on (Taiwan pr. [zhen4] for this sense)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: She edged the pillowcase with lace.
High quality and comfortable pillowcases are usually expensive.
sentences.chinese: 高品質又舒服的枕頭套通常都很貴。

sentences.english: Place the zippered end into the pillowcase first.
sentences.chinese: 將保護套帶拉鍊的一端先放入枕頭套中。

sentences.english: Put equal handfuls of dried hops and lavender flowers into a cotton pillowcase, and seal the end.
sentences.chinese: 把等量的幹酒花和幹薰衣草放進棉枕頭套中並封口。

definition: lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
trying to hide it makes it more conspicuous (idiom); A cover up only makes matters worse.
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
